alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Marion, southeastern Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Stewart, Webster, southwestern Schley and southwestern Sumter Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Manta to near Sanford, and moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Preston, Cusseta, Richland, Plains, Fort Moore, Weston, Sumter, Seminole, Westville, Croxton Crossroads, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Manta, Zellobee, Leveretts, Troutman, and Omaha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster
